l1liuv38Text: AnhedoniaElderlyAsian Working population
l1liuv39Text: EEfRT MADRS/SDSSHAPS/MADRS
l1liuv3bText:
Brintellix® significantly improved measures of
anhedonia† and functioning‡ in MDD, with a clear
dose response§1
Brintellix_NewAss_409499fc7:
Mean difference in change from baseline
in MADRS anhedonia subscale score
vs. placebo (FAS, MMRM)
Brintellix_NewAss_49edd8a1d:
Mean difference in change from
baseline in SDS total score
vs. placebo (FAS, MMRM)
Brintellix_NewAss_4e7307a5d:
Mean difference in change from
baseline vs. placebo
Brintellix_NewAss_477aeabfe:
Mean difference in change from
baseline vs. placebo
Brintellix_NewAss_49970bec4:
• In a post-hoc analysis of a 12-week, randomised, active-controlled trial, Brintellix® (10-20 mg/day)
demonstrated a superior effect on anhedonia and functioning vs. agomelatine (25-50 mg/day) as early
as week 4¶1
Brintellix_NewAss_454df6748:
**p<0.01; ***p<0.001 vs. placebo.
†As measured by MADRS 5-item anhedonia subscale, based on the following MADRS items: 1 (apparent sadness), 2 (reported sadness), 6
(concentration difficulties), 7 (lassitude), and 8 (inability to feel).
‡As measured by SDS.
§Pooled analysis of 11 short-term (6-8 weeks), double-blind, randomised, placebo-controlled studies of Brintellix® (fixed dose, 5–20 mg/day)
in patients with MDD (n=4988).
¶Statistically significant differences for changes from baseline in MADRS anhedonia subscale score (-1.13, p=0.005 at week 4; -1.02, p=0.027
at week 12) and SDS total score (-2.50, p<0.001 at week 4; -1.75, p=0.021 at week 12).1
*Fictitious patient. FAS, full analysis set; MADRS, Montgomery–Åsberg depression rating scale; MDD, major depressive disorder; MMRM,
mixed-model repeated-measures analysis; SDS, Sheehan disability scale.
Brintellix_NewAss_4228d9c50: McIntyre RS et al. Neuropsychiatr Dis Treat 2021;17:575-585.
